content: Does this GPS recognize low bridges
replyContent: Hi Chuck, Yes. Just make sure you enable "clearance" from your app, to recognize low bridges and clearance. To do that, tap on "Places" at the lower left tab, then tap on Places again, just below the zoom (+,- and current location). Then, ensure "clearance" is enabled. Let me know if that helps.

3. Tap Uninstall
4. Confirm “Uninstall”
5. Reboot device

content: Keeps crashing
replyContent:
Looks like this issues has to do with Google's Android webview code, unfortunately affecting Trucker Path as well. Please follow these steps to fix it,

1. Launch the Google Play Store and go to My apps & games
2. Open the “Installed” tab and select Android System WebView
3. Tap Uninstall
4. Confirm “Uninstall”
5. Reboot device

If you wish to proceed with the cancellation, please follow these steps: Launch the Google Play Store app. Tap Menu then Subscriptions and tap on the app that you'd like to cancel. We hope you can enjoy our app again in the future.

content: Don't use it as truck navigation. It will send you through no truck zone. It happened with me. Some of good truck stops not shown on map anymore. I've canceled my subscription. replyContent: Hi Dmitry, we're sorry if you're quite disappointed. Our app is designed to run in the background to maximize its functionality. You can still manage the app settings in your device to reduce power and data consumption. Pricing is provided by a company that tracks current and historical pricing for oil products to ensure accurate info is delivered.

I tried all sorts of virus scanners. Finally used os scanner and it found a dozen internet connections for Trucker Path even when the app had not been open, even after reboot. Deleted Trucker Path and WOW my phone is back to normal. So did the devs sell out to ad companys? Yes!

Our development team will look into this further and we will surely get back to you once we have an update.

content: it was a great app. Then they added a 4th tab for parking availability. Before, the color of the pin represented the parking availability and showed the truck stop logo. Now, you can either know what the availability is or what truck stop it is in the map view. Now, it just shows a "P" and is red yellow or green. Or the truck stop logo and all the pins are red. Why would they do this? You now have to click more to know the same amount of information. Also, If you search for a place and click "show on map", the only pin you see is that one place. Now go back to the main map and you lost that location and have no way of returning without scrolling with your finger and hoping to find that location just so you know what else is in that area. This app was not developed with the fact that 99% of the time it is being used while driving. It isn't designed by drivers and the developers really don't understand the concept of being user friendly. It has potential but they currently have no desire to make things easier to use, the proof is that 4th parking availability tab. I don't want to give comments a thumbs up or down, this isn't YouTube. I want to find a place to park so I can get some rest. I emailed my inquiry and they responded with an automated response thanking me for my input, no actual conversation about why they changed it and how it is supposedly safer to click more while you are driving. They have made it less safe and don't care about it. I canceled my subscription, they don't get anymore of my money.

This feature is currently being developed and will be available in the next version, however, you will still see the points of interest along your route. content: No way to find cheap fuel enroute
replyContent: Hi Peter! Trucker Path has a diesel fuel locator. Easily search for truck diesel closest to you with our GPS locator. Remember to click on a truck fuel stations details to find out if it offers things like overnight parking, tire care, and even get directions from your current location. You can also compare prices to find the cheapest in your area.

content: New update, no triad roads or road numbers now...pathetic

Expect them to make the ads more annoying so you will become a premium member. Also expect them to remove normal features of the app that they will put behind the $2/mo paywall. Hello Pablo, 

Thank you so much for using our app and staying with us for a long time. The absolute majority of our app is free, and with a paid subscription you're not only getting the night mode, but will also receive tons of new useful features, which are coming very soon!

Thanks again, keep on Trucking!

content: Why can't I remove the rest area option? I don't use rest area's & I don't want them on my map while I'm trying to find truck stops!

The rest areas should then be removed from the map. If you have any trouble at all, feel free to email us at support@truckerpath.com or reach out to us on Facebook. We'd be happy to walk you through it.
